Headline: Founder & CEO at Zaigo Infotech, Fieldy | Innovator | Love Solving Complex Problems of Businesses Using Technology, like AI & Software

Headline: Founder at Craft your brand|Ex-VP Community Experience at 1% Club |Simpl |Marketer |Growth Hacker
Comment: Everyone talks about the big vision , India’s decade, innovation, global impact, but it’s the daily grind of outdated systems that quietly kills momentum. We’ve somehow made “this is how it works” an acceptable answer, and that’s what needs to change first. Totally agree, the next leap forward has to come from fixing what’s broken within.

Headline: Entrepreneur | Founder @ Adventroz – Travel. Culture. Legacy. | Helping Founders Build Smarter With Tech, Marketing & Capital
Comment:
This hits a nerve Avik Ashar India’s biggest bottleneck isn’t innovation, it’s integrity.
We can build rockets cheaper than NASA, but can’t get a basic approval without “a call.” That paradox says everything.
World Bank data already shows India loses nearly 3% of GDP annually to administrative inefficiency and corruption leaks. That’s trillions in lost compounding.
If AI can remove friction from customer support and logistics, it damn well can remove friction from governance. But it needs intent, not pilots and press releases.
Clean systems don’t just speed approvals, they restore faith. And that’s the real infrastructure we’re missing.

Headline: VC @35North Ventures (IGF & IDF) | Strategic Partnerships, Fundraising & Investor Relations | XLRI
Comment: Spot on, Avik Ashar. The next revolution isn’t industrial or digital, it’s ethical efficiency. AI’s the broom we need for that rug.

Headline: Co-founder, Executive Director at Rawky Studios | IIT Kharagpur
Comment: A sizeable amount of GST refund has been blocked for us for over a year now; even when the refund application is complying with the regulations.
